page.title: 13Local History LISVANE
page.content: {Rural Past: }At the beginning of the century, the area was wholly rural with farms along the spring line.The characteristic hedge had a small round hollybush above the regular hedge line.Holly still flourishes in the area.Caerphilly cheese was made on the local farms and taken to the autumn cheese market.Samples of the school register for 1914-19 show 50% of parents engaged in farming. {Suburbanisation:}1900 to the First World War big houses were built for shipping families.At the end of that war there were 35 houses in Lisvane. Now the are 500.From 1963 land was developed for housing.Lisvane rapidly became a dormitory suburb of Cardiff. Local changes: Cefn Onn Stores, a vast railway siding during the coal boom, became a naval stores during the II World War now used by Wales Gas.
